intro: Clinogyne ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's clinogyne, is a rare and endemic plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Clinogyne ledermannii is considered a vulnerable species.
